simple.escp.placeholder

Class Placeholder

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.escp.placeholder.Placeholder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicPlaceholder, ScriptPlaceholder

    public abstract class Placeholder
extends java.lang.Object
    Placeholder represent a placeholder in template, such as ${name} or {{salary * 0.5}}.

    Placeholder may have an optional formatting, such as ${salary:currency}. The following format options are available on number value: number, integer and currency. The following options are available on date value: date_full, date_long, date_medium, and date_short.

    All value types support a number as options that will limit the result of this placeholder if number of resulting characters more than this number. For example: ${salary:currency:10} will always take 10 characters. If the actual value is greater than the width, it will be truncated. If the actual value is less than the width, spaces will be appended to it.

    If placeholders has more than one part separated by semicolon (:), the first part should always be name of the placeholder.

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Get the text of this placeholder. All placeholder will be identified in template by their text. For example, placeholder text for ${name} is name.
        Returns:
        text of this placeholder.

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Set the text of this placeholder.
        Parameters:
        text - the text for this placeholder.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Retrieve the maximal width allowed for the value of this placeholder.
        Returns:
        maximal number of characters for this placeholder.

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Set the maximal number of characters for this placeholder.
        Parameters:
        width - new maximal number of characters (width) for this placeholder, or 0 if it is unlimited.

      • getFormat

        public java.text.Format getFormat()
        Get a Format for this placeholder.
        Returns:
        an instance of Format for this placeholder. If no format is defined, this method will return null.

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat(java.text.Format format)
        Set a new Format for this placeholder.
        Parameters:
        format - new format for this placeholder.

      • isSum

        public boolean isSum()
        Determine if this placeholder is for displaying sum of value.
        Returns:
        true if this placeholder is for displaying sum of value.

      • setSum

        public void setSum(boolean sum)
        Set this placeholder to display sum of value instead of the value.
        Parameters:
        sum - if true, this placeholder will return sum of value.

      • isCount

        public boolean isCount()
        Determine if this placeholder is for displaying count of value.
        Returns:
        true if this placeholder is for displaying count of value.

      • setCount

        public void setCount(boolean count)
        Set this placeholder to display count of value instead of the value.
        Parameters:
        count - if true, this placeholder will return count of value.

      • getAlignment

        public StringUtil.ALIGNMENT getAlignment()
        Get the alignment for this placeholder.
        Returns:
        alignment for this placeholder or null if no alignment is specified for this placeholder.

      • setAlignment

        public void setAlignment(StringUtil.ALIGNMENT alignment)
        Set the new alignment for this placeholder.
        Parameters:
        alignment - the new alignment for this placeholder.

      • getCountValue

        public java.lang.Object getCountValue(java.util.Collection value)
        Calculate the count of elements in a Collection.
        Parameters:
        value - a Collection to count for.
        Returns:
        count of elements inside this Collection.

      • getFormatted

        public java.lang.Object getFormatted(java.lang.Object value)
        Get a formatted version, including width limit, of a value.
        Parameters:
        value - the value passed to this placehoder.
        Returns:
        the formatted value. If value is formatted, it will be returned as String. If no formatting is specified for this placeholder, the value will be returned as is.

      • parseFormula

        protected void parseFormula(java.lang.String text)
        Parse aggregation formula such as "sum" and "count" in placeholder text.
        Parameters:
        text - part of text for this placeholder.

      • parseFormatter

        protected void parseFormatter(java.lang.String text)
        Parse formatter such as number, date_full, etc.
        Parameters:
        text - part of text for this placeholder.

      • parseWidth

        protected void parseWidth(java.lang.String text)
        Parse width for a placeholder. By default, width is 0 and no restriction will be applied.
        Parameters:
        text - part of text for this placeholder.

      • parseAlignment

        protected void parseAlignment(java.lang.String text)
        Parse alignment for this placeholder, such as "left", "right", or "center".
        Parameters:
        text - part of text for this placeholder.

      • parseText

        protected void parseText(java.lang.String[] text)
        Parse an expression in placeholder expression. The expression should be broken into multiple keywords that are stored in text.
        Parameters:
        text - an array of string that represent keywords that should be parsed.

      • getValue

        public abstract java.lang.Object getValue(DataSource[] dataSources)
        Retrieve a value from specified DataSource.
        Parameters:
        dataSources - the data sources from where this placeholder retrieves its value.
        Returns:
        the value for the member name.
        Throws:
        InvalidPlaceholder - if can't find the value for the member name in data source.

      • getValueAsString

        public java.lang.String getValueAsString(DataSource[] dataSources)
        Retrieve a value for a Placeholder in form of String.
        Parameters:
        dataSources - the data sources from where this placeholder retrieves its value.
        Returns:
        the value for the placeholder in form of String.
        Throws:
        InvalidPlaceholder - if can't find the value for placeholder is data source.

      • getFormattedValue

        public java.lang.Object getFormattedValue(DataSource[] dataSources)
        Get a formatted version of getValue(simple.escp.data.DataSource[]) .
        Parameters:
        dataSources - the data sources from where this placeholder retrieves its value.
        Returns:
        the formatted value. If value is formatted, it will be returned as String. If no formatting is specified for this placeholder, the value will be returned as is.
